subject: Technology
title: Mosaic: The Browser That Changed Everything
description: A fast breakdown of Mosaic: The Browser That Changed Everything for builders.

hook.text: The early web was text-only. Then in 1993, a browser called Mosaic added images to web pages.

buildup.text: Before Mosaic, you needed technical skill to browse the web. It was a tool for researchers.

discovery.text: Mosaic showed images inline with text and had a simple point-and-click interface for everyone.

twist.text: Downloads exploded. The web went from academic curiosity to mainstream sensation almost overnight.

climax.text: Mosaic's creator, Marc Andreessen, left to co-found Netscape and start the first browser war.

punchline.text: One browser turned the web from nerd tool to world stage.

quiz.question: What made Mosaic revolutionary?
options: It displayed images inline with text
